item.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
item.description: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.

item.title: Honduras election on a knife edge as Trump-backed man slightly ahead
item.description: The US president is threatening to cut aid to Honduras if his favoured right-wing presidential candidate does not win.

item.title: US lawmakers demand answers over Hegseth Venezuela boat strike claims
item.description: Concern over media reports that the US military carried out a second strike killing survivors on a suspected drug boat prompts a bipartisan inquiry.

item.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 500
item.description: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured, after a cyclone hit the region.

item.title: Japanese 'One Piece' singer stopped mid-show after China-Japan feud
item.description: The sudden cancellation of Japanese events in Shanghai have sparked criticism and fanned nationalist sentiment.
